backend

Class Athlete

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseConnectors.DatabaseManager
      • backend.Athlete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Athlete>

    public class Athlete
extends DatabaseManager
implements java.lang.Comparable<Athlete>
    Class that creates an Athlete and has a bunch of functionality related to the athlete and the athletes expected and measured haemoglobin levels.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int athleteID
      Unique integer that is represents only one athlete.
      private java.lang.String firstname
      First name of the athlete.
      private java.lang.String gender
      The athlete's gender.
      private double globinDeviation
      A percentage based variable calculated by comparing the athletes actual, and expected haemoglobin level.
      private java.lang.String lastname
      Last name of the athlete.
      private java.lang.String nationality
      The nationality of the athlete.
      private double normalHeamoglobinLevel
      The expected base haemoglobin level, dependent on gender.
      private java.lang.String sport
      The sport that the athlete practises.
      private java.lang.String telephone
      The athlete's telephone number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Athlete

        public Athlete(int athleteID)
        throws java.sql.SQLException,
               java.lang.NullPointerException
        Constructs an Athlete. Creates a select statement based on the athleteID, and sets all the instance variables. The instance variable normalHaemoglobinevel is set to either 14 if female, or 16 if male.
        Parameters:
        athleteID - athleteID of the athlete.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • getLocation

        public java.lang.String getLocation(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Takes a LocalDate object as parameter and returns a Location-object that corresponds with the input parameter. Returns null if there are no info about the athletes whereabouts at that date.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String

      • getMeasuredAthleteGlobinDates

        public java.util.ArrayList<AthleteGlobinDate> getMeasuredAthleteGlobinDates()
        Returns an ArrayList with AthleteGlobinDate objects that contains all the measured haemoglobin levels, the corresponding dates and the athlete's name. If there are noe measured haemoglobin levels for the athlete, the functions returns null.
        Returns:
        ArrayList with AthleteGlobinDate Objects

      • getExpectedAthleteGlobinDates

        public java.util.ArrayList<AthleteGlobinDate> getExpectedAthleteGlobinDates()
        Returns an ArrayList containing AthleteGlobinDate objects that contains from and to date for every place the athlete goes to. The objects also contains the max haemoglobin level at that place, and the name of the athlete. Returns null if the athlete has no locations added.
        Returns:
        ArrayList with AthleteGlobinDate Objects

      • getMaxGlobinLevel

        private double getMaxGlobinLevel(float altitude,
                                 boolean male)
        Takes an altitude value as a float and a boolean (true if male, false if female) as parameters, and returns the maximum natural haemoglobin level that a person can have at that specific altitude.
        Parameters:
        altitude - altitude as a float value
        male - if the athlete is male a true value, if the athlete is female a false value
        Returns:
        double

      • getExpectedGlobinLevel

        public double getExpectedGlobinLevel(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Takes a LocalDate Object as parameter and returns the athletes expected haemoglobin level at that specific date. Returns 0 if there is noe data about the athlete at that date.
        Parameters:
        date - date as a LocalDate Object
        Returns:
        double

      • getLastMeasuredGlobinLevel

        public AthleteGlobinDate getLastMeasuredGlobinLevel(java.time.LocalDate currentDate)
        Returns an AthleteGlobinObject containing the latest measured haemoglobin level, and the date if was measured. If the latest measured haemoglobin level is more than 4 weeks or older than the parameter date, the function will return null. If the athlete never have taken any haemoglobin tests, the function will return null.
        Parameters:
        currentDate - currentDate as a LocalDate Object
        Returns:
        AthleteGlobinDate

      • setGlobinDeviation

        private void setGlobinDeviation(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Takes a date and sets the athlete's globinDeviation instance variable to a percentage compared to the expected haemoglobin level. Example, if the actual level is 9.0 and the expected is 10.0, the function will return 90.0.
        Parameters:
        date - date a LocalDate Object

      • updateInfo

        public boolean updateInfo(java.lang.String newData,
                          java.lang.String columnName,
                          int athleteID)
        Updates the info of the athlete.
        Parameters:
        newData - newData that is going to be inserted into the Athlete Database at a specific column
        columnName - columnName of the column where data is going to be inserted
        athleteID - athleteID athleteID of the athlete that newData is being added to
        Returns:
        boolean boolean true if successful and false if unsuccessful.

      • updateReading

        public boolean updateReading(java.lang.String newReading,
                             java.lang.String columnName,
                             java.lang.String date)
        Updates the reading of the athlete.
        Parameters:
        newReading - newReading that is going to be inserted into the Athlete Database at a specific column
        columnName - columnName of the column where data is going to be inserted
        date - date as a LocalDate Object
        Returns:
        boolean true if updated, false if not

      • deleteReading

        public boolean deleteReading(java.lang.String date)
        Takes a date and deletes the the athlete's haemoglobin reading at that specific date.
        Parameters:
        date - as a LocalDate Object
        Returns:
        boolean true if deleted, false if not

      • addHaemoglobinReading

        public int addHaemoglobinReading(java.lang.String readingInput,
                                 java.lang.String dateInput,
                                 java.lang.String entry_creator)
        Adds haemoglobin level to the athlete in the database.
        Parameters:
        readingInput - readingInput String that is the haemoglobinLevel that will get inserted into the database. Must be between 5 and 30.
        dateInput - dateInput String that is the date when the haemoglobin reading was done.
        entry_creator - entry_creator String that is the user that took the haemoglobin reading.
        Returns:
        int int 1 if successful, 0 if the user exits the window, -1 if the haemoglobin reading is out of bounds, -2 if the registration fails.

      • addHaemoglobinLevelSQL

        public boolean addHaemoglobinLevelSQL(java.lang.String entry_creator,
                                      double reading,
                                      java.sql.Date date)
        SQL help method for the addHaemoglobinLevel.
        Parameters:
        entry_creator - user who made the reading
        reading - the haemoglobin reading
        date - the dat
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • checkDateFormat

        public java.sql.Date checkDateFormat(java.lang.String dateString)
        Takes a String, checks if it has the right format and then formats it into java.sql.Date. Returns a java.sql.Date Object. Returns null if the String could not be made into a java.sql.Date Object. Make sure to alert the user if this happens.
        Parameters:
        dateString - date as a String
        Returns:
        java.sql.Date

      • checkReadingFormat

        public double checkReadingFormat(java.lang.String readingString)
        Takes a String, and makes it into a double. Returns the double if the parsing went OK. Returns -1 if something went wrong while parsing.
        Parameters:
        readingString - haemoglobin reading as a String
        Returns:
        java.sql.Date

      • getLocationsArray

        public java.lang.String[][] getLocationsArray()
        Gets all the locations of and the from_date and to_date, of the athlete, puts them into a String[][] and returns it.
        Returns:
        String[][]

      • getReadingsUser

        public java.lang.String[][] getReadingsUser(java.lang.String username)
        Makes an Array of haemoglobin readings that the user has taken, together with a date.
        Parameters:
        username - a username of the Collector or Analyst that has submitted a test.
        Returns:
        String[][] Array containing all the readings a specific user has done.

        Returns:
        int

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        String

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Athlete o)
        CompareTo method that compares the globinDeviation variable of one Athlete with another. Returns 1 if this.globinDeviation is the highest, 0 if they are equal and -1 if this.globinDeviation is the smallest.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Athlete>
        Parameters:
        o - the Object that is being compared
        Returns:
        int
